sections.title: Introduction (Wide Shot)
sections.content: I’m Jihad Al Sayed, and in this video we’re introducing linear transformations — a concept that connects algebra and geometry. It’s how we understand stretching, rotating, and projecting vectors using matrices.

sections.title: What Is a Linear Transformation?
sections.content: A linear transformation is a function T such that T(ax + by) = aT(x) + bT(y). It preserves vector addition and scalar multiplication.

sections.title: Matrix Representation of a Transformation
sections.math: T\left(\begin{bmatrix}x \\ y\end{bmatrix}\right) = A \cdot \begin{bmatrix}x \\ y\end{bmatrix},\ \text{where } A \text{ is a matrix}

sections.title: Recap
sections.content: We explored what linear transformations are, how they’re represented by matrices, and saw examples like rotation and projection. This is the bridge between raw algebra and geometric intuition.
